author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> re: **@gakonst**
> Hey guys — did Geth/Erigon try out the GMP integration or make the modexp faster in some way? Think pretty important right?
I was playing around with this yesterday in geth, this might be a good starting point: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/32174

Essentially tried out a few different methods:

- ModExp using GMP where object allocations are done on the C side and a go struct stores pointers
- Same as above, but using a sync.Pool to re-use GMP allocations
- A modexp method written in C that uses GMP, so there is only one cgo call

TLDR; There was at most a 2x speedup on the benchmarks with GMP vs big.Int and GMP was expectedly slower on small bit sizes
